hive_text_custom.text: : Hey, Antoinette, why don’t you tell me about growing up in New York?
: New York. Warren, why do you want to know about that? Well, growing up in New York was lots of fun. I loved growing up in New York.

: Yeah, really. The fun things I did – well, lots of movies to go see but I guess you can see movies anywhere in the US. Anywhere in the world for that matter. I enjoyed being able to go to Lincoln Center for concerts or Carnegie Hall and even play in Carnegie Hall. So I did play in Carnegie Hall.
: Have you ever been to New York?
: Okay. What did you do when you were there?
: The first time, I was with my mother. I was 12 years old. And we went to Central Park and we saw some museums around Central Park.
: You didn’t go into the museums?
: Yes, we did go into the museums.
: Oh, okay. Yeah. That’s my park, Central Park. How did you find my park? Did you like my park?
: It was great. I was surprised how big it was.
: It is a big park. That’s what I like about it. You can
in the park and almost forget that you’re in a city.
: Yeah. That’s what I found really
about it is sometimes I felt like I was in the countryside. But then I would see large buildings.
: Yes. Yeah, I enjoy that, too. Did you know that you could ride horses in the park?
: Did you know about the skating rink in the park?
: Yes. I’ve seen the skating rink on TV.
: Okay. What time of year did you go? What season was it?
: I’ve been there in the summer and in fall but not winter.
: It’s beautiful in any season, I think. I love Central Park.
: Yeah, me too. It was very – it was a
: I’m glad to hear that. What other places did you go to?
: Well, when I was older, I went with my friend and we went on top of the Empire State Building.
: Okay. I’m not sure if they allow you to go up there now.

: That was around 2004 that we went. 
Antoinette: Okay. Were you able to
: I don’t know if I was looking over the edge. I think it’s inside but you’re at the top.
: Okay. So yeah, things have changed a bit since I was a little girl.
: Did it use to be outside that you could go?
: You could go outside. There were these
or I don’t know what they’re called but you put a little change in and you could see the city.
: Yeah. They had those as well.   We could see Central Park and you could even see the Statue of Liberty from there.
: Yeah. Actually, I never got to go. Both times I went to New York, we wanted to go to the Statue of Liberty but we didn’t have enough time.
: Oh well, you should plan another trip.
: I’d like to, yeah. Sounds great.

hive_lesson_quiz.question: 2) Warren went to New York with his _____ .
3) He was surprised how _____ the park was.
4) He went to the top of the _____ .
5) He has not been in New York in _____ .

hive_text_custom.text: I couldn’t imagine growing up anywhere else.
Here, we use the phrase 'I can't imagine' to show amazement about something. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
I can't imagine living without the Internet.
 I love my job. I couldn't imagine working for another company.

hive_text_custom.text: You can get lost in the park.
Here, the phrase 'get lost' means you forget where you are because you are enjoying yourself. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
I love to get lost in a book.
 It is easy to get lost in the park and forget you are in the city.

hive_text_custom.text: Here, 'neat' means interesting. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
That is a neat shirt you are wearing.
 I like your house. It is neat.

hive_text_custom.text: A memorable experience is something we remember easily. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
Living overseas was a memorable experience.
 It was a terrible trip. Let's just say it was a memorable experience.

hive_text_custom.text: Were you able to look over the edge?
Here, 'look over' means to look down to the ground. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
Don't look over the side. You will get scared.
 Can you look over the wall and see what is there?

hive_text_custom.text: Binoculars are special glasses to see things very far away. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
Bird watchers love to use binoculars.
 Ship captains need binoculars.
